alert.note: Alert for Jewell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT FOR NORTHERN JEWELL...NORTHEASTERN SMITH...CLAY...NUCKOLLS... SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN...WEBSTER...ADAMS...FILLMORE AND NORTHWESTERN THAYER COUNTIES... At 629 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Harvard to Rosemont to near Inavale, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Automated Weather Stations have measured wind gusts of 55 to 60 mph along this line of thunderstorms. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Harvard and Lawrence around 635 AM CDT. Clay Center and Saronville around 640 AM CDT. Sutton around 645 AM CDT. Nelson and Burr Oak around 650 AM CDT. Oak, Ong and Nora around 655 AM CDT. Geneva, Mankato, Shickley and Ruskin around 700 AM CDT. Webber around 705 AM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Hastings.
